text: Oh
hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make my grilled
pineapple which is a very simple honey
yogurt dip now I have a fresh pineapple
here that I have just quartered cored
and I put it on these bamboo skewers and
if you're going to grill this like I'm
going to grill this make sure you soak
your skewers in water for at least 30
minutes prior to actually grilling them
but since I'm going to be doing this
tomorrow I just did it for about 30
minutes and then I'm just going to grow
them off tomorrow anyway now I'm
actually going to grill these on the
beach so what I'm going to do is get all
my prep work done ahead of time and then
that way all I have to do tomorrow is
kind of season the pineapple with some
brown sugar a little bit of cinnamon and
then we're going to grill them and
they're going to be ready to eat now for
the yogurt I'm just using some vanilla
yogurt very very simple I'm going to add
in just a touch of honey just to make it
a little bit sweeter and a little tiny
bit of lemon zest you don't need a whole
whole lot but it does add quite a nice
sort of fresh note to this and it goes
really really well with the honey so I'm
just going to give this a nice stir that
looks good now I'm going to cover this
and I'm going to put this into the
fridge and then tomorrow all I'm gonna
do is put this into my cooler and I'm
ready to go and for my pineapple I'm
gonna cover it right now with some
aluminum foil put this in my fridge as
well so that's ready to go and then load
it in the car in the cooler and then
we're off the beach now once you're
ready to grill this make sure that your
grill is no hotter than about medium to
medium-high heat because you're going to
cover this with a little bit of brown
sugar and a sprinkle over some brown
sugar some cinnamon and then you're
going to grill this for a few minutes on
each side for about two to
two-and-a-half minutes on each side or
until it develops beautiful sort of
grill marks charred grill marks and
pineapple starts to become a little bit
tender but not so tender that it
completely falls off your bamboo skewer
because what's the purpose of that it's
something really really easy and simple
perfect for a picnic or the beach when
you're creaming something sweet but you
know especially on the beach you don't
want to bring a basket of brownies
because if you're wearing you know your
behavior your bathing suit you're not
going to feel that comfortable after
you've inhaled a half a dozen brownies
so this is going to fix that sweet tooth
it's going to fix that craving for
something sweet it's going to be easy to
eat easy to eat easy to transport and
easy cleanup because everything is
disposable you can just put everything
in a bag bring it home clean it up or
you can get rid of it it's completely up
to you
I hope you've enjoyed spending time with
me go to www.hsn get this recipe and
I'll see you next time bye bye
